createUserHelp:
You can do this manually in your SQL Server Management Studio.

To do this manually:

1. Bring up your SQL console and connect to the EHR database (typically with your system login and password)

2. Run a SQL query similar to this:

CREATE USER MEDIMAGE;

3. Click the 'Switch to MEDIMAGE user' button below.
createUserHelpFull:
You can do this manually in your SQL Server Management Studio. After a successful connection using the system user, you will be given an option to switch to the MEDIMAGE user (which will give all correct permissions to that user).

To do this manually:

1. Bring up your SQL console and connect to your EHR database (typically with the system login and password)

2. Run similar SQL queries to the following:

CREATE USER MEDIMAGE; GRANT INSERT ON ATTACHMENTSMGR TO MEDIMAGE; GRANT SELECT ON PATIENT TO MEDIMAGE;

3. Set the username to 'MEDIMAGE' above.
